result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew W. Nickel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>10,000g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 8:25 AM Defendant Andrew W. Nickel appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Andrew W. Nickel.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1, 2 and 6; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 are dismissed and read in.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation. Court orders on Counts 1 and 2, 5 years Wisconsin State Prison and 3 years Extended Supervision, each count, concurrent with each other, Count 6 - 9 months Rock County Jail, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, DOC collect costs, 0 days sentence credit.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse program. State to prepare order to forfeit property.
